definitions.definition: a piece of metal or other material, curved or bent back at an angle, for catching hold of or hanging things on.
synonyms: coat rack More"she hung her jacket on the hook"fastener

definitions.definition: a bent piece of metal, typically barbed and baited, for catching fish.
synonyms: snag "I had a fish on the end of my hook"

definitions.definition: a thing designed to catch people's attention.
examples: companies are looking for a sales hook

definitions.definition: a chorus or repeated instrumental passage in a piece of popular music that gives it immediate appeal and makes it easy to remember.
a curved cutting instrument, especially as used for reaping or shearing.
a short swinging punch made with the elbow bent, especially in boxing.
examples: a perfectly timed right hook to the chin
synonyms: slug; informalboff "a right hook to the chin"

definitions.definition: a stroke that makes the ball deviate in flight in the direction of the follow-through (from right to left for a right-handed player), typically inadvertently.
a curved stroke in handwriting, especially as made in learning to write.
an added stroke transverse to the stem in the symbol for an eighth note or other note.
a curved promontory or sand spit.
attach or fasten with a hook or hooks.
examples: the truck had a red lamp hooked to its tailgate
synonyms: clasp "they hooked baskets onto the ladder"

definitions.definition: bend or be bent into the shape of a hook so as to fasten around or to an object.
examples: he hooked his thumbs in his belt
synonyms: curve "he hooked his thumbs in his belt"

examples: I was hooked by John's radical zeal

definitions.definition: strike (the ball) or play (a stroke) so that the ball deviates in the direction of the follow-through, typically inadvertently.
punch one's opponent with the elbow bent.
push (the ball) backward with the foot from the front line in a scrum.
(of a woman) work as a prostitute.
